items.sentence: I wonder whether or not Tom is a picky eater.
That\'s all you\'re interested in, isn\'t it?
I would give anything to be able to be there.
I wrote down her name so as not to forget it.
Tom wanted to know why Mary didn\'t like him.
Tom said that he didn\'t know where Mary was.
Tom said that he didn\'t think it would rain.
You\'re either with us or you\'re against us.
You\'re falling in love with me, aren\'t you?
You\'re giving a speech tomorrow aren\'t you?
I can only stay with you for just a few days.
I can pick you up at the airport if you like.
I can show you around town if you want me to.
Tom packed some essentials into his knapsack.
Tom paid for everything with his credit card.
Tom paid no attention to what Mary was doing.
Tom peeled the potatoes and then boiled them.
Tom persuaded Mary that she should try again.
Tom picked the book up and handed it to Mary.
Tom says the two of you have a lot in common.
My wife works as a nurse at a local hospital.
How could I know that Tom would get so angry?
Would you please air the room while I\'m out?
Tom came here today looking to start a fight.
Tom can hardly support himself on his salary.
It\'s not easy for Tom to get off work early.
It\'s not like I really want to go to Boston.
It\'s not like we have anything better to do.
Tom should\'ve discussed it with his parents.
If you don\'t hurry, you\'ll miss your train.
Tom didn\'t understand a word that Mary said.
Tom didn\'t want me to go shopping with Mary.
I hope I didn\'t make you feel uncomfortable.
Let me see what\'s going on in the next room.
I don\'t think I\'ll be able to eat all this.
Why do we care about what Tom is going to do?
Would you mind if we stayed here for a while?
Tom is the legal owner of this piece of land.
Tom looked around, but Mary was already gone.
Tom lost his glasses somewhere in the garden.
Tom told Mary that he used to live in Boston.
Tom and Mary are going downtown to eat pizza.
Tom thought Mary already knew how to do that.
Tom thought Mary seemed to be gaining weight.
I can\'t believe Tom did all this by himself.
I can\'t believe that Tom is older than Mary.
Tom doesn\'t have any friends here in Boston.
Tom doesn\'t have as many books as Mary does.
Tom doesn\'t have enough credits to graduate.
Tom doesn\'t have time right now to help you.
